Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the capabilities of the "5D medical beds" by suggesting that they will make "3D hospitals" obsolete and eliminate the concept of death.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the existence or functionality of "5D medical beds" and "Crystalline Heart based technology."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image attached to the Facebook posts represents genuine "5D medical beds," when it is actually a 3D model render.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image is not of genuine "5D medical beds," as it is a 3D model render from a stock image site.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating biases in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misleading social media users into believing that the image represents genuine "5D medical beds."
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the expert's verdict.
